intro: Seseli polyphyllum, commonly known as the many-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley, carrots, and other aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves that are often deeply divided, giving it a feathery appearance. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Seseli polyphyllum is adapted to grow in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
